I released a fix to this (testing for null inside the synchronized block), however it does not fix the problem. I can't explain why fPendingSelection can be null in the synchronized block, as the null check and all updates to the variable are done  in synchronized blocks.

Sync Service could be disposed when the UI thread tries to fire a change event.  Added null check to ensure that the sync service is not disposed.

Also fixed null check in ViewPaneRenderingMgr.  rendering could be null as IMemoryRenderingTypeDelegate could return null for #createRendering.
sorry... some how submitted the wrong comment.  Please disregard last comment.
*** Bug 127472 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

What build is your fix in Darin?  I tried I20060213-1200 and it is completely unusable.  I still get the error dialog and afterwards, from the stack trace I can not get the source for anything but the last step and I can not see the variables for anything but the last step.
The fix does not work. We can't explain why yet.

Created an attachment (id=34621)
patch showing the synch block is enteried > 1 time
The call to set selection results in a "set data" callback that re-attempts the selection.
Fixed in AsynchronousTreeModelViewer (dont attempt to update selection on "set data" callback).
